attributes.resource.name: Art classes at Richmond Art Center

attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
You can register for a class online, in-person, or over the phone:

-Online Registration: 
1) Select your desired class in the course catalog (http://richmondartcenter.org/class-catalog/)
2) Click on the registration button to sign-up for the course. You will be then be asked to create an account (you do not need to be a member to create an account but if you are a member you will 10% discount)
3) If the class is full you can select to be placed on the waitlist

-In-Person Registration: 
1) You can register in-person at the front desk from Tuesday ? Saturday, 10 am ? 5 pm

-By-Phone Registration:
1) Call 510.620.6772 during their hours of operation, Tuesday-Saturday, 10 am ? 5 pm to register over the phone. 
2) If no one answers leave a voicemail with your name and phone number 

* Scholarships can be completed online at http://richmondartcenter.org/programs/scholarships/ You can also complete the application attached and bring it in-person when you register for classes
attributes.service.type.name: Out-of-School Time Programs

nodes.label: State Disability Insurance (SDI) at California Employment Development Department

attributes.service.name: State Disability Insurance (SDI)
attributes.resource.name: State Disability Insurance (SDI) at California Employment Development Department
attributes.eligibility:
-Be unable to do your regular or customary work for at least eight days.
-Be employed or actively looking for work at the time your disability begins.
-Have lost wages because of your disability.
-Have earned at least $300 from which State Disability Insurance (SDI) deductions were withheld during your base period. (See http://www.edd.ca.gov/Disability/Calculating_DI_Benefit_Payment_Amounts.htm for more information)
-Be under the care and treatment of a licensed physician/practitioner or accredited religious practitioner within the first eight days of your disability.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
ONLINE:
Visit http://www.edd.ca.gov/Disability/SDI_Online.htm to apply online.

OR 

MAIL:
1. Call 1-800-480-3287 OR visit a local SDI office to get paper application.
2. Fill out Part A
3. Have a physician fill out Part B
4. Mail application to:
State of California
Employment Development Department
P.O. Box 989777
West Sacramento, CA 95798-9777

*Be sure to talk to your physician/practitioner about their process for submitting a DI claim; they do not all follow the same process. Some offices may have you mail in Part B, while others may mail in Part B themselves. Physicians can also complete Part B online.
attributes.service.type.name: SSI/SSDI
attributes.materials.to.bring:
-Social Security number.
-California Driver License number.
-Most current employer?s business name, phone number, and mailing address (as stated on your W-2 or paystub).
-Last date you worked your regular duties and hours or date you began working at less than full duty or modified duty.
-Your physician/practitioner must complete the ?Physician/Practitioner Certification?
-(If applicable) workers? compensation claim information
-(If applicable) Any wages you received or expect to receive from your employer (sick leave, paid-time-off, etc.)
-(If applicable) If you receive in-patient treatment at an alcoholic recovery home or drug-free facility, provide the name, address, and phone number of the home or facility.
attributes.target.population: NA

nodes.label: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and Human Services - Antioch

attributes.service.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals
attributes.resource.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and Human Services - Antioch
attributes.eligibility:
1. Income: If your annual income is below 138% of the Federal Poverty Level, you may qualify for income-based Medi-Cal. To check if you qualify based on income, see the first two columns of household incomes and the row that matches your household size here: https://www.coveredca.com/PDFs/FPL-chart.pdf
- If you have SSI, you automatically qualify for SSI-Linked Medi-Cal.

2. Immigration status: Any income-eligible lawfully present OR not lawfully present California resident can apply for Medi-Cal BUT Medi-Cal coverage may be limited for California residents who are not lawfully present 
- Not lawfully present residents are not eligible for any Covered California plans
- DACA recipients are not considered lawfully present
- If you have lawfully present family but you are not lawfully present, you may still apply for Medi-Cal for them. Please see this website for more information: https://www.coveredca.com/individuals-and-families/getting-covered/immigrants/

3. You may also qualify for MediCal if you are: 65 or older, blind, disabled, under 21, pregnant, in a skilled nursing or intermediate care home, on refugee status for a limited time, or have been screened for breast and/or cervical cancer. 

*Please remember there are many eligibility criteria, so it best to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To apply for MediCal: 
1. Online: Complete the Covered California online application here (Covered California and Medi-Cal use the same online application): http://www.coveredca.com/apply/
- You will need to create an online account to apply online, so please have a personal email address to use. 

2. By phone: Call Covered California Service Center at (800) 300-1506 to apply over the phone Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. OR to schedule someone to call you so you can enroll, visit: https://app.bigwavesystems.com/lp/a8c3085e-e597-4ac8-ba23-42f245fdfa11

3. In-person: Go to your local county human services office to fill out and submit a Covered California application in person. To find your nearest office, see here: http://www.dhcs.ca.gov/services/medi-cal/Pages/CountyOffices.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: Child Health Insurance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
To fill out an application you need the following information: 
-  Social Security numbers for applicants who are U.S. citizens, or document information for lawfully present immigrants who need insurance. (You only need to give this information for people in your household who are applying for coverage)

- Employer and income information for everyone in your family, even if they are not applying (Paystubs)

- Your federal tax information. For example, the person who files taxes as head of household and the dependents claimed on your taxes. (If you do not file taxes, you may still qualify for Medi-Cal coverage)

- Health insurance information for you or anyone in your household who receives it through a job

- Immigration documents for non-citizens, such as an ?A? number, USCIS number or arrival/departure document number.
attributes.target.population: Low-income adults, families with children, pregnant women, seniors, persons with disabilities, children in foster care, and former foster youth up to age 26.

nodes.label: Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) at WIC San Pablo

attributes.service.name: Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)
attributes.resource.name: Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) at WIC San Pablo
attributes.eligibility:
You can apply if 

1. You satisfy one of the following: 

- Are pregnant
-Are breastfeeding a baby that is under 1 years old
-Had a baby in the past 6 months
-Have children under 5 years of age (including those cared for by a single father, grandparent, foster parent, step-parent or guardian)

2. Meet the income requirements (see attached "WIC Income Guidelines 2018-2019")

3. Be at nutritional risk (risk will be determined through a health and diet screening. Blood work will be required)

4. Live in Contra Costa County
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
You must apply for WIC in-person. To enroll:

1. Fill out an online form (https://cchealth.org/wic/index.php#contact) and an enrollment agent will get back to you to schedule an appointment. 

2. Visit the WIC Office for your appointment. Make sure to bring all of your documents. 

3. Wait for your WIC application to be processed. The WIC office will get back to you when you have been approved. Processing time varies on a case-by-case basis.

* If you have any questions call your local WIC office:
Concord: 925-646-5370
San Pablo: 510-231-8600
attributes.service.type.name: WIC
attributes.materials.to.bring:
1. Personal ID  (ex: photo ID)
2. WIC form filled out by your doctor (available at your hospital or clinic)
3. Proof of income
4. Proof of address (any piece of mail)
attributes.target.population:
-Pregnant women
-New mothers
-Infants and children under 5 years old
-Grandparents or caretakers of children 
-Foster Families

nodes.label: Supported Employment Program (SEP) at California Department of Rehabilitation - Richmond

attributes.service.name: Supported Employment Program (SEP)
attributes.resource.name: Supported Employment Program (SEP) at California Department of Rehabilitation - Richmond
attributes.eligibility:
To be eligible for services, you must: 
- have a physical or mental impairment that substantially prevents you from getting employment 
- require vocational rehabilitation service to prepare for, get, keep, or regain employment consistent with your unique strengths, resources, priorities, concerns, abilities, interests, and informed choice;
- be able to benefit from the DOR's services in terms of an employment outcome in an integrated setting.
(If you are receiving Social Security Administration benefits or if you have a valid "Ticket to Work," you are presumed eligible for DOR services.)
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Request DOR service in one of these ways: 
- Fill out and sign a DR 222 Vocational Rehabilitation Services Application: https://www.dor.ca.gov/Content/DorIncludes/documents/Forms/dr0222.pdf
- Visit an America's Job Center of California rehabilitation service: http://www.edd.ca.gov/Office_Locator/
2. Provide the DOR with information necessary to begin an assessment to determine your eligibility and priority for services.
3. Be available to complete the assessment process. This includes activities such as attending the initial interview, watching an orientation video, participating in the evaluation of your skills and capabilities, and completing your part of any actions you and your counselor agree upon.
attributes.service.type.name: Job Placement Services (e.g. One Stop Career Center)
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- Photo ID 
- Proof of California residence 
- Any documents you have about your disability
- Recent records and benefit letters such as those from the Social Security Administration or your ?Ticket? from the federal Ticket to Work Program.
- A list of names, addresses, and telephone numbers of doctors, professionals, and organizations you have consulted about your disability.
attributes.target.population: Persons with disabilities interested in getting or keeping employment

nodes.label: Medical Baseline Program- Financial Assistance for Utilities for people with medical conditions at Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG & E)

attributes.service.name: Medical Baseline Program- Financial Assistance for Utilities for people with medical conditions
attributes.resource.name: Medical Baseline Program- Financial Assistance for Utilities for people with medical conditions at Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG & E)
attributes.eligibility:
To qualify, a California-licensed physician must certify that a *full-time resident* in your home has one of the following medical issues:

- Dependency on life-support equipment at home
- Paraplegic, hemiplegic or quadriplegic condition
- Multiple sclerosis with special heating and/or cooling needs
- Scleroderma with special heating needs
- Life-threatening illness or compromised immune system, and special heating and/or cooling are needed to sustain life or prevent medical deterioration

*If you are not sure you meet the eligibility requirements, talk to your doctor.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
Download and print attached application. You need a referral from your doctor (they complete part B of the application). 

Fill-out and mail to:

PG&E
Attention: Medical Baseline
P.O. Box 8329
Stockton, CA 95208
attributes.service.type.name: Energy Assistance/Subsidies (LIHEAP)
attributes.materials.to.bring: Need your PG&E account number
attributes.target.population: PG&E customers with qualifying medical conditions

nodes.label: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Hercules

attributes.service.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals
attributes.resource.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Hercules
attributes.eligibility:
1. Income: If your annual income is below 138% of the Federal Poverty Level, you may qualify for income-based Medi-Cal. To check if you qualify based on income, see the first two columns of household incomes and the row that matches your household size here: https://www.coveredca.com/PDFs/FPL-chart.pdf
- If you have SSI, you automatically qualify for SSI-Linked Medi-Cal.

2. Immigration status: Any income-eligible lawfully present OR not lawfully present California resident can apply for Medi-Cal BUT Medi-Cal coverage may be limited for California residents who are not lawfully present 
- Not lawfully present residents are not eligible for any Covered California plans
- DACA recipients are not considered lawfully present
- If you have lawfully present family but you are not lawfully present, you may still apply for Medi-Cal for them. Please see this website for more information: https://www.coveredca.com/individuals-and-families/getting-covered/immigrants/

3. You may also qualify for MediCal if you are: 65 or older, blind, disabled, under 21, pregnant, in a skilled nursing or intermediate care home, on refugee status for a limited time, or have been screened for breast and/or cervical cancer. 

*Please remember there are many eligibility criteria, so it best to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To apply for MediCal: 
1. Online: Complete the Covered California online application here (Covered California and Medi-Cal use the same online application): http://www.coveredca.com/apply/
- You will need to create an online account to apply online, so please have a personal email address to use. 

2. By phone: Call Covered California Service Center at (800) 300-1506 to apply over the phone Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. OR to schedule someone to call you so you can enroll, visit: https://app.bigwavesystems.com/lp/a8c3085e-e597-4ac8-ba23-42f245fdfa11

3. In-person: Go to your local county human services office to fill out and submit a Covered California application in person. To find your nearest office, see here: http://www.dhcs.ca.gov/services/medi-cal/Pages/CountyOffices.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: Child Health Insurance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
To fill out an application you need the following information: 
-  Social Security numbers for applicants who are U.S. citizens, or document information for lawfully present immigrants who need insurance. (You only need to give this information for people in your household who are applying for coverage)

- Employer and income information for everyone in your family, even if they are not applying (Paystubs)

- Your federal tax information. For example, the person who files taxes as head of household and the dependents claimed on your taxes. (If you do not file taxes, you may still qualify for Medi-Cal coverage)

- Health insurance information for you or anyone in your household who receives it through a job

- Immigration documents for non-citizens, such as an ?A? number, USCIS number or arrival/departure document number.
attributes.target.population: Low-income adults, families with children, pregnant women, seniors, persons with disabilities, children in foster care, and former foster youth up to age 26.

nodes.label: LINK ADA Paratransit Bus Service at County Connection

attributes.service.name: LINK ADA Paratransit Bus Service
attributes.resource.name: LINK ADA Paratransit Bus Service at County Connection
attributes.eligibility:
-You have a disability or health condition that prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation. They decide your eligibility based on the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). 

-You live in the County Connection LINK ADA Paratransit service area. 

-You may be eligible for for all or some of their transit trips, based on your specific condition.

-If you are eligible for ADA Paratransit by County Connection LINK, you can also use other ADA Paratransit services in the Bay Area.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Fill out the LINK ADA Paratransit application (attached). 
You can also get the application from the LINK office at 2477 Arnold Industrial Way in Concord, download it online, or call (925) 680-2066 or (925) 680-2067 to have it mailed to you. 

If you need help, or you need an application in Braille, audiotape, or diskette, call (925) 680-2066 or (925) 680-2067.

2. Mail the application or bring it in-person to:
ADA CERTIFICATION 
The County Connection 
2477 Arnold Industrial Way 
Concord, CA 94520

3. After they get your application:
-You may get a telephone call so they can get more information;
-They may send your application to your health professional to ask about your disability, and/or
-They may ask you  to come to the County Connection office for an in-person interview.

They will tell you by mail within 21 days after they get your completed application if you are eligible.
attributes.service.type.name: Public Transit Assistance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
-Completed applications
-Any other documentation that may help your case (this is recommended, not required)
attributes.target.population: People with disabilities who cannot ride fixed-route public transportation.

nodes.label: Relief for Energy Assistance through Community Help (REACH) Program at The Salvation Army - Richmond

attributes.service.name: Relief for Energy Assistance through Community Help (REACH) Program
attributes.resource.name: Relief for Energy Assistance through Community Help (REACH) Program at The Salvation Army - Richmond
attributes.eligibility:
1. You must have a residential account with PG&E, and the bill must be in your name. 
2. You must have proof of a hardship or unforeseen change in your ability to pay your PG&E bill. 
3. You CANNOT be living in subsidized housing, unless you are a senior, permanently disabled, or are terminally ill. 
4. You have NOT received help from REACH within the past 12 months
5. Your income must not exceed income guidelines. 
You can find the guidelines here: (https://www.pge.com/en_US/residential/save-energy-money/help-paying-your-bill/longer-term-assistance/care/care.page)
6. If you do not have legal status you can still apply if you can provide proof of income and address.
7. You must have received either a 15-day or a 48-hour disconnection notice
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Determine whether you qualify by reviewing the eligibility requirements.
2. Contact the REACH program at 1-800-933-9677.



You can also visit the Salvation Army located in El Sobrante and let them know you are interested in the REACH program. They are open on Tues and Wed from 9am-4pm.
attributes.service.type.name: Shut Off Protection
attributes.materials.to.bring:
1. Bring your 15-day or 48-hour notice (if you are over 62 or permanently disabled, you do not need to)
2. Bring proof of income
3. Bring proof of a hardship, emergency, or unforeseen change in the last 120 days that made it difficult to pay your PG&E bill (ex: paying for an emergency room visit, paying for a dentist visit, paying for prescription eye-glasses).
4. ID
attributes.target.population: NA

attributes.resource.name: Tutoring for grade school/high school students at Metas
attributes.eligibility: - Students in preschool to 12th grade
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Visit the application website here: http://cccmetas.com/apply.html
2. Click the "Pollitos" button if your child is in preschool to 3rd grade OR "Metas" if your child is in 4th grade to 12th grade
3. Click the "Download Pollito Application" OR "Download Metas Application" button to access either the Pollito or Metas application

attributes.service.type.name: Tutoring

- the Pollito application 

If you are applying for the Metas program (4th grade to 12th grade), please bring: 
- The Metas application, which includes: 
  - The Contra Costa College application 
  - Concurrent Enrollment Form (with principal's signature)
  - Your child's latest grades 
  - Consent and Release form

If you are applying and need help with the application, Metas offers labs that students that come into to fill out the application in person with assistance from the center.
attributes.target.population: Children and teenagers in need of tutoring

nodes.label: Community College Classes at Los Medanos College

attributes.service.name: Community College Classes
attributes.resource.name: Community College Classes at Los Medanos College
attributes.eligibility:
- You must either be a high school senior OR have a GED
- High school students wishing to take college courses before graduation are also welcome
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
For students living in the United States:
1. Create an account for the online application here: https://www.opencccapply.net/uPortal/f/u63l1s1000/normal/render.uP
2. Fill out and submit the online application to receive an email with your student ID number and next steps.
3. Once you have submitted an application and received an email, complete the online orientation here: https://www.losmedanos.edu/lmcorientation/
4. Once you complete the online orientation, you will need to follow the steps for completing online and in-person assessments here: https://www.losmedanos.edu/assessment/
4. Once you finish the online assessment, schedule an appointment for the in-person assessment 

For international students: 
1. Create an account for the online application here: https://www.opencccapply.net/uPortal/f/u63l1s1000/normal/render.uP
2. Complete the International Student Application here: https://dbelman.wufoo.com/forms/q1dl0rhm0to13jk/
3. Wait for your acceptance letter and I-20 form to follow the next steps found at this website: https://www.losmedanos.edu/inted/apply.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: College
attributes.materials.to.bring:
For students living in the United States:
- High school transcript
- Other college transcript, if applicable 
- AP Scores/college placement scores, if applicable
- Photo ID 

For international students: 
- A document (in English) demonstrating your English proficiency 
- A bank statement showing that you have the equivalent of $23, 600.00 USD for the 2018-2019 school year
- $50 non-refundable application fee
attributes.target.population: Anyone who wants to pursue a higher education beyond high school

In-person meetings generally only address initial claim questions. 

Disability benefits can take 3~4 months. Appeals must be made within 60 days after notification of denial and instructions will be mailed with the notification.

Contact information: 3164 Garrity Way, Richmond, CA 94806. Phone Number: (877) 877-3116. 

Find the online application here: https://secure.ssa.gov/RIL/SiView.action

nodes.label: Phlebotomy Technician Program at Kaiser Permanente School of Allied Health Sciences

attributes.service.name: Phlebotomy Technician Program
attributes.resource.name: Phlebotomy Technician Program at Kaiser Permanente School of Allied Health Sciences
attributes.eligibility:
You must be 18 years or older with a high school transcript, GED, or 12 college credits to apply.

You must submit a completed application packet and complete and pass the mandatory background check and drug screening policy. Failure to complete requirements will result in the loss of your eligibility. 

After submission of a completed application packet, you will be required to take and achieve a passing score on the Wonderlic Scholastic Level Exam. Exam is administered at the KPSAHS Richmond campus during the application period and must be completed by the specified deadline. 

Physical Requirements
You should be physically able to:
1. Stand and/or walk up to 6.5 hours throughout an 8-hour shift
2. Lift and move a minimum of 50 pounds
3. Operate all laboratory equipment
4. Reach forward 18 inches, bend, crouch, or stoop 20 times per hour
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Create an online application profile here: https://www.mykpsahs.com/Applicant/ApplyOnline_Login.aspx
2. Submit the online application and pay the $65.00 applciation handling fee via PayPal AFTER you have submitted the application 
3. Have your official academic transcripts (high school, GED or college for 12 semester of 18 quarter credits from a regionally accredited institution) mailed in a sealed envelope to:
Kaiser Permanente School of Allied Health Sciences
Attn: Admissions Department
938 Marina Way South
Richmond, CA 94804
4. Register for an in-person assessment exam at the KPSAHS Richmond campus here: https://www.eiseverywhere.com/phleboassess
5. Attend the in-person assessment and bring your valid American Heart Association BLS Provider Card that certifies you as CPR trained
6. Bring the BLS Provider Card to the Admissions Office on the day of your in-person assessment exam
attributes.service.type.name: Job Training (e.g. Medical Assistant Training)
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- A credit/debit card for your $65.00 non-refundable application handling fee via PayPal
- Valid American Heart Association Basic Life Support for Health Care Providers Card (CPR)
- Your official sealed transcript mailed directly to Kaiser Permanente School of Allied Health Sciences
attributes.target.population: Anyone interested in becoming a Phlebotomy Technician.

nodes.label: CalFresh - Food Stamps for CA residents at Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services - West County

attributes.service.name: CalFresh - Food Stamps for CA residents
attributes.resource.name: CalFresh - Food Stamps for CA residents at Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services - West County
attributes.eligibility:
- Your household Income must be lower than the following amounts depending on the size of your household: 
Household Size                 Gross Income 
1                                         $2,024 
2                                           2,744 
3                                           3,464 
4                                           4,184 
5                                           4,904 
6                                           5,694 
7                                           6,344 
8                                           7,064 
Each Additional 
Member                                +720
- You MUST be a U.S. citizen OR a ?Qualified Immigrant,? which includes Permanent Legal Residents (holders of green cards), refugees, asylees (an individual who has been granted asylum), people granted withholding of deportation or removal, Cuban/Haitian entrants, individuals paroled into the U.S. for a least one year by immigration authorities, conditional entrants (temporary green card), and certain victims of domestic violence. Victims of human trafficking (T visa) and applicants for U visa/interim relief are also eligible for CalFresh.
- Supplemental Security Income/State Supplementary Payment (SSI/ SSP) Program recipients do NOT qualify for CalFresh, but other people in the person's household may still qualify for CalFresh
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. There are 2 ways to start your application: 
- Online: Select your county and apply at http://www.benefitscal.org/
- In-Person: Print and fill out an application in the language of your choice under the Application Forms section of this website: http://www.cdss.ca.gov/food-nutrition/calfresh and submit it your local county social services agency location here: http://www.cdss.ca.gov/County-Offices
2. Once your county social services agency receives your application, they will contact you to set up an interview to go over your application. Be sure to gather/bring all necessary materials for your interview.
3. It may take up to 30 days to process your application. The County will send you a letter to let you now if you are approved** or denied. 

**NOTE: If you qualify, you may be able to get benefits within 3 calendar days, if:
-Your household?s monthly gross income (income before deductions) is less than $150 and cash on hand/checking/savings accounts is $100 or less
- Your housing costs (rent/mortgage and utilities) are more than your monthly gross income and cash on hand/checking/savings accounts
-You are a migrant or seasonal farm worker household with less than $100 in checking/savings and your income has
stopped, or if your income has started but you do not expect to get more than $25 in the next 10 days.
attributes.service.type.name: Food Stamps/SNAP
attributes.materials.to.bring:
You MUST use the following materials to fill out your application AND bring them to your interview: 
- Identification (Driver?s License, State ID card, passport). 
- Proof of Residence (a rental agreement, current bill with your address listed). 
- Social Security Numbers for everyone in the household who has one (see note below about certain noncitizens). 
- Proof of money in the bank for all the people in your household (recent bank statements). 
- Proof of earned income of everyone in your household for the past 30 days (recent pay stubs, a work statement from an employer). 
  - NOTE: If self-employed, income and expense or tax records. 
- Proof of unearned income (Unemployment benefits, SSI, Social Security, Veteran?s benefits, child support, worker?s compensation, school grants or loans, rental income, etc.). 
- Poor of lawful immigration status ONLY for noncitizens applying for benefits (an Alien Registration Card, visa). 
  - NOTE: Certain noncitizens applying for immigration status based on domestic violence, crime prosecution or trafficking may not need this proof. They also may not need a Social Security Number.

To receive more benefits, you may use these materials to fill out optional parts of the application AND bring them to your interview: 
- Housing costs (rent receipts, mortgage bills, property tax bill, insurance documents). 
- Phone and utility costs. 
- Medical expenses for anyone in your household who is elderly (60 and older) or disabled. 
- Child and adult care costs due to someone working, looking for work, attending training or school, or participating in a required work activity. 
- Child support paid by a person in your household
attributes.target.population: Low-Income California residents in need of assistance paying for food

nodes.label: One-time rental assistance for East Bay individuals and families at Catholic Charities of the - East Bay Concord Service Center

attributes.service.name: One-time rental assistance for East Bay individuals and families
attributes.resource.name: One-time rental assistance for East Bay individuals and families at Catholic Charities of the - East Bay Concord Service Center
attributes.eligibility:
1. You must live in the locations served by the office locations below: 
- Oakland Service Center: Alameda, Albany, Ashland, Berkeley, Castro Valley, Emeryville, Hayward, Oakland, Piedmont, San Leandro, and San Lorenzo
- Concord Service Center: Central and Eastern Contra Costa County and the City of Richmond
2. You must be one of the following:
- A family or single parent with children under 18 years of age
- A senior over 55 years of age
- An individual with a permanent disability
3. You must be experiencing a housing crisis like one of the following:
- A loss of housing due to a disaster
- A loss of employment
- Other documented crisis
4. You must show that you have enough income to support your family and housing needs after this one-time help
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Call the Catholic Charities office that serves your area to see if they are accepting applications (please see the Eligibility above):
- Concord Service Center: (925) 825 3099
- Oakland Service Center: (510) 768 3100
2. If the office that serves your area is accepting applications, visit the office for their Housing Clinics during the following times: 
- Concord Service Center: Housing Clinics are on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of each month from 9:30 to 11:30 am
- Oakland Service Center: Housing Clinics are on the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of each month from 9:00 to 11:30 am.
attributes.service.type.name: Rental Assistance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
For Back Rent: Notice of eviction, be residents of Alameda or Contra Costa County, and have proof of income.

For Deposit Assistance: Leasing agreement or letter of intent to rent, be residents of Alameda or Contra Costa County, and have proof of income.
attributes.target.population: Families and individuals in the East Bay experiencing a housing crisis

attributes.service.name: After school program/performing arts
attributes.resource.name: After school program/performing arts at East Bay Center for the Performing Arts
attributes.eligibility: No family is turned away for inability to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
After school program/performing arts at East Bay Center for the Performing Arts

The recommended time to go would be after school hours and it would depend on how many after school programs your child is taking. All classes are cancelled on holidays such as MLK, President's Day, Memorial Day Weekend. 

You can apply for a class after school whether it is for your child or for a family activity. You can sign up for any classes anytime. 
The best person to contact about the After School Program would be Mara Lockowandt, mara.lockowandt@eastbaycenter.org or (510) 323-2494. 

There is a registration fee rather than an application where at the beginning of each Fall and Spring session, they will collect $15 per individual student or $30 per family. And it does not take long to process. 

You need to be a part of the organization to participate in/get the resource. The cost of the money will depend on what session and says the client will go to.

There are also private lessons or instructions if you would like more than just an after school program. Follow the link from above.
attributes.service.type.name: Out-of-School Time Programs
attributes.materials.to.bring: See student registration form attached to this entry. Also included is a scholarship application.
attributes.target.population: Children 3 to 18. Programs for younger children include family involvement.

attributes.service.name: Eyeglasses for low-income individuals (OneSight)
attributes.resource.name: Eyeglasses for low-income individuals (OneSight) at LensCrafters-Concord
attributes.eligibility: You will need to have your visual and financial need verified by a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization (such as a school, church, Lions Club, Prevent Blindness, Red Cross, or United Way).
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Get a referral letter from a non-profit organization (such as a school, church, Lions Club, Prevent Blindness, Red Cross, or United Way). The referral letter should be on company letter head with the organization tax-ID number. It should also include your name and birth date.

2. Take the referral letter issued by the nonprofit as well as a valid prescription to a participating location (LensCrafters, Target Optical, Sears Optical or Pearle Vision corporate store) to receive a pair of glasses at no charge.
*It is also recommended that you call the location to schedule an appointment.

3. If you do not already have a valid prescription (one that is less than 2 years old) you can ask if the onsite doctor at the optical retailer is able to donate an eye exam or they can reach out to Prevent Blindness (https://www.preventblindness.org/vision-care-financial-assistance-information) for assistance.
attributes.service.type.name: Vision Care
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- Bring your referral letter 
- Bring your prescription for glasses (if you have one that is no more than 2 years old)
attributes.target.population: Low-income individuals who need eye glasses

attributes.service.name: Free Legal Assistance - Benefits Denial
attributes.resource.name: Free Legal Assistance - Benefits Denial at Bay Area Legal Aid - San Francisco
attributes.eligibility: Must be a US citizen/resident or U Visa holder; Those who are not must call Legal Advice Line to do an intake and determine their eligibility
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1.Clients wanting to access service MUST call Legal Advice Line first to do an intake, then set up an appointment to go into office. Call the Legal Advice Line Monday-Friday 9AM to 5PM. Call as close to 9 AM as possible, because they receive many calls. 

****NO DROP-INS, must communicate by phone until in-person appointment is made

Please be patient until your call is answered. You can also leave a message, and an attorney will return your call before the end of the day. Keep your phone close by, because they will only make one call back attempt. 

2. An attorney will give you legal advice over the phone. You can also set up an appointment to go to their office in-person.

Bay Area Legal Aid also offers weekly Housing Law Clinics. Have your Advocate check their calendar for the day and time of the clinic at (https://baylegal.org/get-help/find-an-office/contra-costa-county/).

nodes.label: Utility Discount- Family Electric Rate Assistance (FERA) Program at Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG & E)

attributes.service.name: Utility Discount- Family Electric Rate Assistance (FERA) Program
attributes.resource.name: Utility Discount- Family Electric Rate Assistance (FERA) Program at Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG & E)
attributes.eligibility:
Program Guidelines

1. The PG&E bill must be in your name. (For sub-metered tenants, the energy bill from your landlord must be in your name.)
2. You must live at the address where the discount will be received.
3. You may not be claimed as a dependent on another person's income tax return other than your spouse.
4. You may not share an energy meter with another home.
5. You must account for all sources of qualifying household income and meet the program income guidelines.
6. You must notify PG&E if your household no longer qualifies for the FERA discount.
7. Following enrollment, you may be selected for income verification and must provide proof of qualifying household income in order to remain on the program.
8. You are required to recertify your eligibility every two years

Please view website for INCOME guidelines.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
You can apply online, via telephone, or visit the website.

List of Locations can be found at:
http://www.pge.com/includes/docs/pdfs/myhome/customerservice/financialassistance/care/education/COC_Enhanced_Info_List.pdf


Once application is completed, clients can mail (or submit online) the completed application to:

Pacific Gas and Electric Company
CARE Program
Attn: COC Processing
PO Box 7979
San Francisco, CA 94120-7979
attributes.service.type.name: Electric, Water, Gas & Oil Discount
attributes.materials.to.bring: Completed application-  online or through a community partner
attributes.target.population: NA

nodes.label: Family Housing Program (Transitional and Emergency) at Greater Richmond Interfaith Program (GRIP)

attributes.service.name: Family Housing Program (Transitional and Emergency)
attributes.resource.name: Family Housing Program (Transitional and Emergency) at Greater Richmond Interfaith Program (GRIP)
attributes.eligibility:
1. You must be a family with children. 
2. You or your family members do NOT need to be documented.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. You and your family must visit the shelter to complete an intake form. Be sure to bring all the required documents. You can visit Monday-Friday 9am-5pm Closed during Lunch 12-1pm

2. If you are approved, your family will be put on a waitlist. How long you have to wait can vary. Availability is based on capacity and your family size. 

3. You will be called once you are off the waitlist.
attributes.service.type.name: Emergency Shelter
attributes.materials.to.bring:
1. You must have some kind of ID for ALL members of your family and yourself. (Copies are OK,  and can be provided by other agencies you are touch with (ex: proof of food stamps along with a photo ID, or from communication with a social worker)
Bring as much ID as you can.

nodes.label: In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS) at Contra Costa County Department of Employment and Human Services

attributes.service.name: In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS)
attributes.resource.name: In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS) at Contra Costa County Department of Employment and Human Services
attributes.eligibility:
You must be:
1. A legal California resident who lives in your own home. You CANNOT be living in a hospital, nursing home, assisted living, or licensed care-facility.

2. 65 or older*, blind, or long-term disabled. 
*Disabled children may be eligible too. 

3. Must have a MediCal eligibility determination
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. The IHSS office of the Contra Costa Employment & Human Services Department encourages people to call if they wish to apply. Call (925) 229-8434 during regular business areas. 

2. If no one picks up, you MUST leave a message with your name and phone number. Someone will get back to you within 2 business days.  

3. The Department will give you an application. Fill out your part.  Your doctor has to fill out and fax the [Health Care Certification (SOC 873) form] to the Department. 

4. After the Department gets all of the forms, a Social Worker will call to arrange an interview at your home. The Social Worker will assess the type of help you need and the number of hours your caregiver can work. 

5. The Department will let you know if you are approved or denied. 

6.  You can hire anyone that is old enough and legally employable to be your caregiver. If you don't have anyone in mind,  you can call  (800) 333-1081  to choose a caregiver from a registry.
attributes.service.type.name: Home Health
attributes.materials.to.bring: Completed Health Care Certification (SOC 873)
attributes.target.population: Elderly or disabled individuals in need of home care

nodes.label: Community College Classes at Diablo Valley College

attributes.service.name: Community College Classes
attributes.resource.name: Community College Classes at Diablo Valley College
attributes.eligibility:
You must be 18 years or older and have one of the following:

     - a high school diploma

     - a passing grade on the California Certificate of Proficiency Test or General Education Development Test (GED) 

Special accommodations can be made for a student that wants to take community college classes during their last year of high school.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1) Start first by completing the online application at http://www.dvc.edu/future/steps/index.html. Once completed, you will get a DVC student ID number, registration date, important student account information, and a link to the online orientation within 24 hours

2) If you are a new student, you have to attend an online orientation (link will be provided in email) 

3)You also have to take an assessment for placement into math and English classes. You can schedule an appointment at https://www.dvc.edu/enrollment/assessment/index.html

(Not all students are required to complete an assessment. Visit https://www.dvc.edu/enrollment/assessment/need-assessment.html to see if this step applies to you)

4) After completing the assessment, you should register for Counseling 095. This is a six hour academic advising class where you will meet with a counselor and develop an education plan. You will also learn about transferring and potential degree pathways.

5) If you complete the steps above for priority registration, you will receive an improved registration date in your InSite portal. You can enroll in classes through InSite. 

For questions about the enrollment process call 925-685-1230 (Pleasant Hill) or 925-866-1822 (San Ramon)
attributes.service.type.name: College
attributes.materials.to.bring: Your student ID number
attributes.target.population: Anyone who wants to pursue a higher education beyond high school

attributes.eligibility: Contra Costa county residents.

1. Call the Patient Access Line at (800) 495-8885, Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm
2. Press 1 if the appointment if you have a medical record with Contra Costa Health Services.
- You will then dial the nine digits of the medical record number on your account
3. Press 2 if the appointment if you have a Contra Costa Health Plan (CCHP) I.D. card.
- You will then dial the CCHP member I.D. number on the CCHP ID card
4. Press 3 if the appointment if you have health insurance such as Medi-Cal or Medicare.
- You will then enter the social security number and #
5. Press 4 to speak with a financial counselor.
- A Financial Counselor may help you if you are not sure if you have health coverage in Contra Costa County or if you want to enroll in the health benefits you?re eligible to receive.


OR

You can schedule an appointment online at : mycclink.cchealth.org

nodes.label: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Pleasant Hill

attributes.service.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals
attributes.resource.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Pleasant Hill
attributes.eligibility:
1. Income: If your annual income is below 138% of the Federal Poverty Level, you may qualify for income-based Medi-Cal. To check if you qualify based on income, see the first two columns of household incomes and the row that matches your household size here: https://www.coveredca.com/PDFs/FPL-chart.pdf
- If you have SSI, you automatically qualify for SSI-Linked Medi-Cal.

2. Immigration status: Any income-eligible lawfully present OR not lawfully present California resident can apply for Medi-Cal BUT Medi-Cal coverage may be limited for California residents who are not lawfully present 
- Not lawfully present residents are not eligible for any Covered California plans
- DACA recipients are not considered lawfully present
- If you have lawfully present family but you are not lawfully present, you may still apply for Medi-Cal for them. Please see this website for more information: https://www.coveredca.com/individuals-and-families/getting-covered/immigrants/

3. You may also qualify for MediCal if you are: 65 or older, blind, disabled, under 21, pregnant, in a skilled nursing or intermediate care home, on refugee status for a limited time, or have been screened for breast and/or cervical cancer. 

*Please remember there are many eligibility criteria, so it best to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To apply for MediCal: 
1. Online: Complete the Covered California online application here (Covered California and Medi-Cal use the same online application): http://www.coveredca.com/apply/
- You will need to create an online account to apply online, so please have a personal email address to use. 

2. By phone: Call Covered California Service Center at (800) 300-1506 to apply over the phone Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. OR to schedule someone to call you so you can enroll, visit: https://app.bigwavesystems.com/lp/a8c3085e-e597-4ac8-ba23-42f245fdfa11

3. In-person: Go to your local county human services office to fill out and submit a Covered California application in person. To find your nearest office, see here: http://www.dhcs.ca.gov/services/medi-cal/Pages/CountyOffices.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: Adult Health Insurance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
To fill out an application you need the following information: 
-  Social Security numbers for applicants who are U.S. citizens, or document information for lawfully present immigrants who need insurance. (You only need to give this information for people in your household who are applying for coverage)

- Employer and income information for everyone in your family, even if they are not applying (Paystubs)

- Your federal tax information. For example, the person who files taxes as head of household and the dependents claimed on your taxes. (If you do not file taxes, you may still qualify for Medi-Cal coverage)

- Health insurance information for you or anyone in your household who receives it through a job

- Immigration documents for non-citizens, such as an ?A? number, USCIS number or arrival/departure document number.
attributes.target.population: Low-income California residents in need of health coverage.

attributes.resource.name: Rental Assistance at Shelter Inc.
attributes.eligibility:
-Must have some form of income and show proof of income (e.g. public benefits, employment, etc.). 
-Have lived in Contra Costa County or Solano County for at least 6 months
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1.To request assistance in Contra Costa County, Call: 925.338.1038.

To request assistance in Solano County, Call: 707.652.7311 or email RCS@caminar.org
Their hours are Mon-Fri, 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM (except holidays). If they do not answer leave your name and phone number

2) Once you register, an intake specialist will call you within 7 business days to schedule an appointment. They will go over what type of documentation you need to bring in.

3) The intake specialist will review your case and let you know if you qualify for assistance and for how much

*If you receive TANF/CalWORKs, IHSS, CAPI, or ILSP, contact your caseworker at the Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services Department for help. You can find the appropriate phone number to call at this link: (https://ehsd.org/overview/contact/).
attributes.service.type.name: Rental Assistance
attributes.materials.to.bring: Depends on your situation and source of income. The representative will give you specific instructions when you contact them.
attributes.target.population: Families and individuals who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.

nodes.label: Free Food for Low-Income Families in West Contra Costa County at Richmond Emergency Food Pantry

attributes.service.name: Free Food for Low-Income Families in West Contra Costa County
attributes.resource.name: Free Food for Low-Income Families in West Contra Costa County at Richmond Emergency Food Pantry
attributes.eligibility:
1. Your entire household must meet the following income guidelines: http://www.foodbankformontereycounty.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/2018-Income-Guidelines.pdf
2. You and your family must live in West Contra Costa County r
3. Meet income guidelines (see attachment)

You do NOT need to be part of the church to get food from this church.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Add up the monthly income of everyone in your household. 
2. Collect the photo IDs of everyone in your household IF you have six or more people in your household 
3. Visit Richmond Emergency Food Pantry on Tuesday or Friday between 10:30 am and 2:30 pm with your monthly household income, your photo ID, bags/a cart and the photo IDs of everyone in your household if necessary 
4. Tell the volunteer your monthly income and show them your ID and your family members' ID cards if necessary 
5. Collect the food and return to Richmond Emergency Food Pantry once a month on any Tuesday or Friday from 11:00 pm to 3:00 pm.
attributes.service.type.name: Pantries & Soup Kitchens
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- Your photo ID 
- Photo ID for every member of your household IF there are six or more people in your household
- Bags or a cart for food
attributes.target.population: Low-income families in West Contra Cost County in need of food

nodes.label: English as a Second Language (ESL) Classes at Contra Costa College

attributes.service.name: English as a Second Language (ESL) Classes
attributes.resource.name: English as a Second Language (ESL) Classes at Contra Costa College
attributes.eligibility:
- You must be age 18 or older 
- You must have a high school diploma or a GED
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1) Apply to become a student at Contra Costa College by going online to www.contracosta.edu and clicking on ?Apply Now.? After you submit an application, you will get an email with your Student Identification (ID) Number.
2) Complete your assessment by either calling the Assessment Center at (510) 215-3896 OR clicking ?Book Appointment? on the Assessment Center website here: https://www.contracosta.edu/admissions/apply-now/assessment/
3) Visit the Assessment Center in the Student Services Center, Room 104 at the time of your appointment with a valid photo ID
4) Complete the Online Orientation for all new students here: http://www.contracosta.edu/admissions/apply-now/orientation/
5) Create an Educational Plan on the InSite website. On the searchable schedule, search for Contra Costa College and look for ?COUNS-108? under courses on the InSite website here: http://insite.4cd.edu/
6) After you have completed all these steps, you will be bale to register for ESL classes.
attributes.service.type.name: ESL, ESOL
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- A Contra Costa College application on file with the Admissions & Records Office (meaning that you have applied online) 
- Your Contra Costa College student ID number 
- a valid photo ID (e.g. Driver?s License, High School ID, Passport, etc.)
attributes.target.population: Non-native English Speakers

nodes.label: CalFresh - Food Stamps for CA residents at Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services - Central County

attributes.service.name: CalFresh - Food Stamps for CA residents
attributes.resource.name: CalFresh - Food Stamps for CA residents at Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services - Central County
attributes.eligibility:
- Your household Income must be lower than the following amounts depending on the size of your household: 
Household Size                 Gross Income 
1                                         $2,024 
2                                           2,744 
3                                           3,464 
4                                           4,184 
5                                           4,904 
6                                           5,694 
7                                           6,344 
8                                           7,064 
Each Additional 
Member                                +720
- You MUST be a U.S. citizen OR a ?Qualified Immigrant,? which includes Permanent Legal Residents (holders of green cards), refugees, asylees (an individual who has been granted asylum), people granted withholding of deportation or removal, Cuban/Haitian entrants, individuals paroled into the U.S. for a least one year by immigration authorities, conditional entrants (temporary green card), and certain victims of domestic violence. Victims of human trafficking (T visa) and applicants for U visa/interim relief are also eligible for CalFresh.
- Supplemental Security Income/State Supplementary Payment (SSI/ SSP) Program recipients do NOT qualify for CalFresh, but other people in the person's household may still qualify for CalFresh
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. There are 2 ways to start your application: 
- Online: Select your county and apply at http://www.benefitscal.org/
- In-Person: Print and fill out an application in the language of your choice under the Application Forms section of this website: http://www.cdss.ca.gov/food-nutrition/calfresh and submit it your local county social services agency location here: http://www.cdss.ca.gov/County-Offices
2. Once your county social services agency receives your application, they will contact you to set up an interview to go over your application. Be sure to gather/bring all necessary materials for your interview.
3. It may take up to 30 days to process your application. The County will send you a letter to let you now if you are approved** or denied. 

**NOTE: If you qualify, you may be able to get benefits within 3 calendar days, if:
-Your household?s monthly gross income (income before deductions) is less than $150 and cash on hand/checking/savings accounts is $100 or less
- Your housing costs (rent/mortgage and utilities) are more than your monthly gross income and cash on hand/checking/savings accounts
-You are a migrant or seasonal farm worker household with less than $100 in checking/savings and your income has
stopped, or if your income has started but you do not expect to get more than $25 in the next 10 days.
attributes.service.type.name: Food Stamps/SNAP
attributes.materials.to.bring:
You MUST use the following materials to fill out your application AND bring them to your interview: 
- Identification (Driver?s License, State ID card, passport). 
- Proof of Residence (a rental agreement, current bill with your address listed). 
- Social Security Numbers for everyone in the household who has one (see note below about certain noncitizens). 
- Proof of money in the bank for all the people in your household (recent bank statements). 
- Proof of earned income of everyone in your household for the past 30 days (recent pay stubs, a work statement from an employer). 
  - NOTE: If self-employed, income and expense or tax records. 
- Proof of unearned income (Unemployment benefits, SSI, Social Security, Veteran?s benefits, child support, worker?s compensation, school grants or loans, rental income, etc.). 
- Poor of lawful immigration status ONLY for noncitizens applying for benefits (an Alien Registration Card, visa). 
  - NOTE: Certain noncitizens applying for immigration status based on domestic violence, crime prosecution or trafficking may not need this proof. They also may not need a Social Security Number.

To receive more benefits, you may use these materials to fill out optional parts of the application AND bring them to your interview: 
- Housing costs (rent receipts, mortgage bills, property tax bill, insurance documents). 
- Phone and utility costs. 
- Medical expenses for anyone in your household who is elderly (60 and older) or disabled. 
- Child and adult care costs due to someone working, looking for work, attending training or school, or participating in a required work activity. 
- Child support paid by a person in your household
attributes.target.population: Low-Income California residents in need of assistance paying for food

nodes.label: Regional Transit Connection (RTC) Discount ID/ Clipper Card at Clipper Customer Service at AC Transit

attributes.service.name: Regional Transit Connection (RTC) Discount ID/ Clipper Card
attributes.resource.name: Regional Transit Connection (RTC) Discount ID/ Clipper Card at Clipper Customer Service at AC Transit
attributes.eligibility:
1. Under age 65
2. Have a certified disability 

For Basic Eligibility:
1. Have a Medicare card.
2. Have a valid DMV placard
3. Have a card for disability from another California transit agency
4. Be a Disabled US Veteran
-If you do not meet basic eligibility or if you travel with an attendant, you must apply under Medical Eligibility.

For Medical Eligibility:
1. Complete the Medical Certification form. Your doctor must sign to verify your disability.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
You must apply for an RTC Clipper card in-person at a participating transit agency.

List of Transit Agencies by Location: 
http://transit.511.org/RTC/RTDC.aspx#Locations


To apply for a RTC Discount ID Card:
1. Complete an application form for either ?Basic? or ?Medical? eligibility. 
-If applying under "Basic" eligibility, you can download the form online. 

-If applying under "Medical" eligibility, forms are available in-person from your transit agency. You can also call the listed phone number to request that they mail the form to you. See * below for details on how to complete the Medical eligibility form. 

2. Go to a local participating transit agency during their hours of operation. See here for a list Transit Agency RTC Processing locations: (http://511.org/transit/accessibility/discount#)

3. Bring valid government-issued photo identification. See 'Materials to Bring' section for forms of valid ID. 

4. For ?Basic? eligibility, also bring the applicable documentation listed on the form. See 'Materials to Bring' section for forms of valid ID

5. Pay the non-refundable application fee:
-$3 new, renewal, or visitor card
-$5 replacement card

6. Take a photo at the transit agency to complete your application.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*To complete the form for Medical Eligibility:
1. Complete the appropriate sections of the Medical Certification form. 

2. Sign the application in two places: a) to allow your doctor to release information, and b) to accept the RTC Program terms. 
If you do not sign your application in both places, they will not process the application. 

3. Bring the Medical Certification form to your licensed professional. The licensed professional must complete the form and mail the green copy to the Discount ID Card Program Office at the address shown on the form. 
See here for a list of licensed professionals: (http://511.org/transit/accessibility/eligibility)

4. Keep the other copies of the form. Bring them with you when go have your photo taken at the transit agency.
attributes.service.type.name: Public Transit Assistance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
1. Completed application form for either ?Basic? or ?Medical? eligibility

2. Valid government-issued photo identification:
-current California driver?s license
-California Identification Card
-U.S. passport
-Alien Registration Card
-U.S. Military Identification Card or Military Dependent Card.

3. Application fee:
-$3 for new, renewal, or visitor card
-$5 for replacement card

4. For ?Basic? eligibility, bring applicable documentation: 
-Medicare card
-California DMV Placard Registration parking placard receipt. If you bring the blue placard, you must also bring the registration receipt. If you have disabled license plates (DP) instead of a placard, you must submit a ?Medical Eligibility? form.
-Other California transit agency card that is equal to the RTC Card.
-Proof of Veterans Disability:
a) a copy of your Service Connected Disability ID card  
b) VA Certification letter showing a disability rating for aid and attendance, or for a service-connected disability with a rating level of 50% or higher. 

5. For "Medical eligibility, bring the other copies of the Medical Certification Form.
attributes.target.population: Disabled under 65 years old

nodes.label: Emergency Cash Grant at Season of Sharing Fund

attributes.service.name: Emergency Cash Grant
attributes.resource.name: Emergency Cash Grant at Season of Sharing Fund
attributes.eligibility:
You must be a: Senior citizens (55+), disabled individual, or low-to-moderate income family with dependent children who have a critical need.

You must live in the counties of Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Solano or Sonoma. 

-They do help serve undocumented immigrants. 
-Pregnant women without born children are not eligible for SOS UNLESS they are in their 3rd trimester.
- Parents of foster children who are paid are NOT eligible.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
If you or someone you know needs temporary assistance and might qualify for a grant, please contact the coordinating agency in the county in which you live. 

See the attached PDF for contact information. For Contra Costa, the number is 925 521 5065.
attributes.service.type.name: Emergency Cash/Grant/Charity Money
attributes.materials.to.bring:
a). Proof of crisis (job loss, fire, flood, eviction notice, etc.)
b). Social Security cards for all family members (for children, parents must prove they are parents of children OR have legal custody)
c). Birth certificates for all family members
d). Proof of income
e). Proof of residency in county (if homeless, show proof of living in homeless shelter)
f). If you receive Section 8, must show a copy of your Section 8 voucher and copy of apartment inspection
g). If need rental assistance: show copy of lease
h). If need rental deposit assistance: show copy of lease for both the place you are moving out of AND the place you are moving into
attributes.target.population: Bay Area residents in need of financial assistance

nodes.label: Senior Transportation & Paratransit at The City of San Pablo Paratransit Services

attributes.service.name: Senior Transportation & Paratransit
attributes.resource.name: Senior Transportation & Paratransit at The City of San Pablo Paratransit Services
attributes.eligibility:
1. You must be a San Pablo resident
2. You must be a senior (age 55 or older), OR
3. You must be an adult (age 18 or older) with a disability
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Print and fill out the application found here: https://www.sanpabloca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/9225/Revised-Transportation-Application?bidId=
2. If you are age 18 to 54 with a disability, ask your doctor for a note that verifies your disability. 
3. Mail, fax, drop off or email the application and doctor's note (doctor's note is needed only if you are age 18-54 with a disability) to: 
City of San Pablo  Senior & Disabled Transportation
13831 San Pablo Avenue, Building 5
San Pablo, CA 94806
Fax: (510) 215-2114
Email: Belinda Graham at belindag@sanpabloca.gov or paratransit@sanpabloca.gov
4. Once you have enrolled, visit the Senior & Disabled Transportation office at 13831 San Pablo Avenue, Building 5 on Monday to Friday from 8 am to 5 pm to purchase a $20 book of Door to Door tickets 
5. Book your ride at least one business day in advance.

This application must be renewed yearly
attributes.service.type.name: Public Transit Assistance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- The completed application found here: https://www.sanpabloca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/9225/Revised-Transportation-Application?bidId=
- A doctor's note verifying your disability, if you are age 18-54 with a disability
- $20 in cash, check or money order
attributes.target.population: San Pablo residents who are seniors (55+) and/or disabled (18+)

attributes.eligibility:
-You have a disability that prevents you  from using public transportation.
-You live in the ADA Paratransit service area. You must call and tell them your address to find out if you live in the areas they serve. 

If you are not eligible for WestCAT, you may be eligible for East Bay Paratransit.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1.  Fill out the WestCAT ADA application (attached). They only have ADA applications in English. You must complete the application in English. 

If you need help filling out the application, or you need an application in Braille, audiotape, or diskette, call (510) 724-6320.

2. Mail the application or bring it in-person to:
601 Walter Ave. 
Pinole, CA 94564 
Attn: ADA Coordinator

3. After you turn in your application, WestCAT will send paperwork to your doctor to ask about your disability. 

4. Within 21 days of submitting your completed application, you will get a letter that lists the services you are eligible for. If WestCAT has not decided your eligibility by 21 days, you are eligible to use ADA Paratransit until they tell you you are not eligible.

attributes.materials.to.bring: NA
attributes.target.population: People who need medical transportation, but cannot ride public transportation due to a disability.

nodes.label: Discounted basic phone services at California LifeLine Program

attributes.service.name: Discounted basic phone services
attributes.resource.name: Discounted basic phone services at California LifeLine Program
attributes.eligibility:
You can qualify for CCLP if you or another person in your household is

1.Enrolled in any of the following public assistance programs:
-Medicaid/Medi-Cal
-LIHEAP
-SSI
-Federal Public Housing Assistance or Section 8
-SNAP
-WIC
-NSL
-TANF, Tribal TANF
-CalWORKs, StanWORKs
-WTW
-GAIN
-Bureau of Indian Affairs General Assistance
-Head Start Income Eligible (Tribal Only)
-Food Distribution Program on Indian Reservations
-Federal Veterans and Survivors Pension Benefit Program

OR

2. Meet income guidelines below (valid until May 29, 2019. See cpuc.ca.gov website below after May 29th for update income guidelines): 

Household Size                         Income Limit 
1-2                                              $27,000
3                                                 $31,300
4                                                 $38,100
Each Additional Member            add $6,800

Please refer to this website for more details: http://www.cpuc.ca.gov/General.aspx?id=2752#qualify
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Contact and inform your home or cell phone company that you want to apply for the CCLP.  The home or cell phone company must be an approved California LifeLine telephone service provider. Use this website to see if your phone company is eligible: https://www.californialifeline.com/en/provider_search

2.  After you discuss and verify your eligibility with your home/cell phone company, they will begin the application process by sending you a pink application in the mail with a PIN number within three weeks. 

3. Complete the California LifeLine Discount application in of the two ways below:
a. ONLINE: Go to www.californialifeline.com and apply using your PIN number. 
b. PAPER: Complete, sign, and submit your application by mail to: 

California LifeLine Administrator
P.O. Box 8417
Westminster, CA 92684-8417

Make sure you provide proof of ALL income in your application. Make sure to submit your application by the due date on the application. 

5. You will receive an approval letter or a letter of disqualification.
attributes.service.type.name: Telephone & Internet Subsidies
attributes.materials.to.bring:
You must provide proof of income which can be one or more of the following: 
- Identification card from a qualifying public assistance program (see Eligibility above)
- Notice of eligibility or decision letter of participation from a qualifying public assistance program
-Front page only of prior year?s state (540, 540A, 540 2EZ, 540NR, or 540X), federal (1040, 1040A, 1040EZ, 1040NR, 1040NR-EZ, 1040SS, or 1040X), or tribal tax return
- Income statements or paycheck stubs for 3 consecutive months within the past 12 months
- Statement of benefits from Social Security, Veterans Administration, retirement/pension, Unemployment Compensation, and/or Workmen?s Compensation
- Alimony and/or child support documents
- Other official documents.
attributes.target.population: Low-income California residents in need of discounted cell and home phone service

nodes.label: Certified Nursing Assistant - Home Health Aide Program at Contra Costa College

attributes.service.name: Certified Nursing Assistant - Home Health Aide Program
attributes.resource.name: Certified Nursing Assistant - Home Health Aide Program at Contra Costa College
attributes.eligibility:
- You must have a valid Social Security Number
- You must have a valid driver's license or state ID
- You must have an American Heart Association CPR certification for the Healthcare Provider 
- You must have a College Reading Assessment score indicating placement into English 142B OR you must have completed English 81 with a grade of C or better
- You must have a College Writing Assessment score indicating placement into English 142B OR you must have completed English 84 with a grade of C or better
- If English is not your first language, you must have an ESL Reading and Writing scores indicating ESL Level 3 Reading and Writing OR you must have completed ESL 146 and ESL 186 with a score of C or better
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Complete a CPR course like Contra Costa's EMED 109 to receive an American Heart Association CPR Certification for the Healthcare Provider 
2. Pick up the Nurse Assistant application from the Contra Costa Nursing Department or Counseling Office
3. Submit the Nurse Assistant application and all the materials to bring before the deadline stated on the application
4. Once approved, register for Nurs 198- Nurse Assistant Certification Program and/or Nurs 199- HHA at Admissions and Records Office
5. Once registered, get your fingerprints scanned for free at the CCC Campus Police as part of the mandatory background check process. You will need to bring a valid state ID/driver's license
attributes.service.type.name: Job Training (e.g. Medical Assistant Training)
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- Nurse Assistant Application
- Assessment testing results OR grades from equivalent English classes from the College Assessment Center in Room 104 of the Student Services Center 
- Medical Packet that includes a completed physical exam form 
- Draft copy of State application CDPH 283B to the nursing office (The Nursing Office will send you an official one to sign later)
attributes.target.population: Individuals interested in becoming certified nursing assistants and/or home health aids

nodes.label: Free Legal Assistance - Housing at Bay Area Legal Aid - San Francisco

attributes.service.name: Free Legal Assistance - Housing
attributes.resource.name: Free Legal Assistance - Housing at Bay Area Legal Aid - San Francisco
attributes.eligibility: You must have income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Line. Check if you are at or below FPL here: (https://aspe.hhs.gov/poverty-guidelines).
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
Call the Legal Advice Line during their hours (Mon & Thurs 9:30 am-3:00 pm; Tue & Wed 9:30 am-1:00 pm) at (800) 551-5554. 

*Call as close to 9:30 am as possible, because they receive many calls. 

Please be patient until your call is answered. You can also leave a message, and an attorney will return your call before the end of the day. Keep your phone close by, because they will only make one call back attempt. 

2. An attorney will give you legal advice over the phone. 

OR

-You can also set up an appointment to go to their office in-person.

*Bay Area Legal Aid also offers weekly Housing Law Clinics. Check their calendar for the day and time of the clinic at https://baylegal.org/get-help/legal-clinic-calendar/.
attributes.service.type.name: Housing Conditions
attributes.materials.to.bring:
-Proof of income (pay stubs and proof of government benefits)
-Documents related to your legal issue
attributes.target.population: Low-income residents of the Bay Area in need of legal assistance.

nodes.label: Car Seat Program at First 5 - Richmond/San Pablo

attributes.service.name: Car Seat Program
attributes.resource.name: Car Seat Program at First 5 - Richmond/San Pablo
attributes.eligibility:
1. You must be a parent of a child that is 0-5 years old. Pregnant women are also eligible. 
 
2. You must be low-income- call to speak to a representative to see if you are eligible. 

3. Become a member of  First 5 Contra Costa [to access classes and items (ex: car seats)]
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. To enroll in First 5, call the office location nearest you. Phone numbers for each office can be found at: http://www.first5coco.org/funded-programs/first-5-centers/

You can also go to the nearest office and tell the front desk you want to register. The person will give you registration forms (for emergency contact, child information [weight, height], etc) to sign. Offices are usually open Mon-Fri 9am-5pm. 

2.Take at least one class at First 5. The person you register with will help you choose and sign up for classes. Classes are usually 4-6 weeks long and meet weekly. There are drop-in/parenting classes, and some classes include meals. You must be with your child at all times during classes. 

You can look at class schedules by location at http://www.first5coco.org/funded-programs/first-5-centers/

3. Once you enroll at any First 5 Center, ask the office to make an appointment with the Center?s car seat tech. It could take up to 3 weeks to get an appointment.
