nodes.label: Paid Family Leave at Employment Development Department

attributes.service.name: Paid Family Leave
attributes.resource.name: Paid Family Leave at Employment Development Department
attributes.eligibility:
In order to be eligible for PFL benefits, you must:

-Be unable to do your regular or customary work for at least eight days due to the need to provide care to a seriously ill family member or to bond with a new child.
-Be employed or actively looking for work at the time your family leave begins.
-Have lost wages because you were caring for a seriously ill family member or bonding with a new child.
-Have earned at least $300 from which SDI deductions were withheld during your base period. For additional information, visit Calculating Paid Family Leave Benefit Payment Amounts.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To receive benefits, you must:

- File a claim for PFL benefits using SDI Online (http://www.edd.ca.gov/Disability/SDI_Online.htm) or by mail. 
-Applications are available at your local Department of Social Services.
Serve a seven-day, unpaid waiting period unless you are a new mother transitioning from a Disability Insurance pregnancy-related claim.
-Have at least $300 in wages that are subject to SDI contributions (look for ?SDI? on your paystubs) during the 12-month base period of your claim.
-Provide proof of relationship for bonding claims (birth certificate or record, adoption paperwork, etc.).
-Have the care recipient?s physician/practitioner certify to the disability by completing the ?Physician/Practitioner?s Certification? for care claims.
attributes.service.type.name: SSI/SSDI
attributes.materials.to.bring: NA
attributes.target.population: NA

nodes.label: (Early) Head Start at Las Deltas Head Start

attributes.service.name: (Early) Head Start
attributes.resource.name: (Early) Head Start at Las Deltas Head Start
attributes.eligibility:
You must be age and income eligible to enroll in Early Head Start or Head Start. 

1. Age eligibility: 
-For Early Head Start: child(ren) must be age 0-3. 
-For Head Start: child(ren) must be age 3-5, or turn age 3 by September 1st. Otherwise, you must wait to enroll during the next cycle in July. 

2. Income eligibility: Family income be under 130% of federal poverty guidelines. 

3. Need eligibility: If you want to enroll in the full-day, full-year childcare program, you must be working, in school or training, or incapacitated. If you are looking for employment, you must submit a declaration that you will find a job in 60 days to remain eligible for full-day care. 
There is no need eligibility if you are enrolling for part-time child care. 


Eligibility to be on the waitlist works based on a point system. Children at risk for child abuse or with special needs will have higher priority. The agency is happy to review your eligibility when you contact them.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
First, leave your name and phone number on the eligibility hotline and someone will call you back within 48 hours

-(English & Spanish) West County: 510.374.7144
-(English & Spanish) Central and East County: 925.427.8852

You can also print out and complete a pre-screening form (see attached) and fax it to (925) 313-8303, Attn. Christina. You can also mail it to 1470 Civic Court, Suite 200, Concord, CA 94520 Attn. Christina
attributes.service.type.name: (Early) HeadStart
attributes.materials.to.bring: The program will tell you which materials to bring once you submit the Pre-application screening form.
attributes.target.population: Low-income families seeking childcare for children age 0-5.

nodes.label: Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) at Richmond WIC

attributes.service.name: Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)
attributes.resource.name: Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) at Richmond WIC
attributes.eligibility:
You can apply if 

1. You satisfy one of the following: 

- Are pregnant
-Are breastfeeding a baby that is under 1 years old
-Had a baby in the past 6 months
-Have children under 5 years of age (including those cared for by a single father, grandparent, foster parent, step-parent or guardian)

2. Meet the income requirements (see attached "WIC Income Guidelines 2018-2019")

3. Be at nutritional risk (risk will be determined through a health and diet screening. Blood work will be required)

4. Live in Contra Costa County
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
You must apply for WIC in-person. To enroll:

1. Fill out an online form (https://cchealth.org/wic/index.php#contact) and an enrollment agent will get back to you to schedule an appointment. 

2. Visit the WIC Office for your appointment. Make sure to bring all of your documents. 

3. Wait for your WIC application to be processed. The WIC office will get back to you when you have been approved. Processing time varies on a case-by-case basis.

* If you have any questions call your local WIC office:
Concord: 925-646-5370
San Pablo: 510-231-8600
attributes.service.type.name: WIC
attributes.materials.to.bring:
1. Personal ID  (ex: photo ID)
2. WIC form filled out by your doctor (available at your hospital or clinic)
3. Proof of income
4. Proof of address (any piece of mail)
attributes.target.population:
-Pregnant women
-New mothers
-Infants and children under 5 years old
-Grandparents or caretakers of children 
-Foster Families

3. After orientation, you will officially become a member. You can then approach any staff directly or over the phone by calling the number (510) 374-3401 and get access to the Education & Career Development programs

attributes.service.name: Food Pantry and Food Boxes
attributes.resource.name: Food Pantry and Food Boxes at Bay Area Rescue Mission - Food Pantry and Distribution Center
attributes.eligibility: - Anyone can access the food pantry
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To Access the Food Pantry: 
1. The Bay Area Rescue Mission gives out food Monday-Saturday starting at 1:15pm to 2:30pm sometimes later depending on how many people there are in line. 

2. It is recommended to go to the pantry earlier than 1PM if possible. Typically, there is a long line and they give food away until it is gone 

To Access Food Boxes: 
You can get a food box once very other month. The box includes: canned food, meat, dry goods, and any fruits and vegetables they have available. 

1. Arrive between 8AM and 10:59pm it is very important to arrive before 11am for the food boxes as they will not distribute the box if arrival is after 11am.
2. Let the workers know you are coming to pick up a food box. 

-  A referral is required if you need a specialized food box to cater to your needs dietary needs. If you do not require a specialized food box, a referral is not needed. The referral letter should speak to your need and express your gratitude. 
- You can find a referral template letter attached. Be sure to add a line about what your dietary restrictions/specialized food needs are.
attributes.service.type.name: Pantries & Soup Kitchens
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- A referral letter for your specialized food box (only needed if you have dietary restrictions)
- You need to bring your ID to receive a food box
attributes.target.population: Individuals & families in need of food in the Bay Area of California

3. If you do not already have a valid prescription (one that is less than 2 years old) you can ask if the onsite doctor at the optical retailer is able to donate an eye exam or they can reach out to Prevent Blindness (https://www.preventblindness.org/vision-care-financial-assistance-information) for assistance.

nodes.label: East Bay Paratransit at East Bay Paratransit

attributes.service.name: East Bay Paratransit
attributes.resource.name: East Bay Paratransit at East Bay Paratransit
attributes.eligibility: You must have a disability or disabling health condition that prevents you from using regular transit (AC Transit and BART) without help from another person. Eligibility criteria comes from the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1) Complete the written application (attached).

-If you need help, or need the application in a certain format (such as Braille or audio), call their office at (510) 287-5000, extension 5.

2) Once you complete the application, call (510) 287-5000, ext. 5 to set up an in-person interview at their office. Do NOT mail or fax your application. They will determine your eligibility at the interview.

-Bring your completed application with your to your interview. 

-East Bay Paratransit will provide transportation at no cost if you need a ride to and from the interview. Tell them if you need a ride to the interview when you call. 

3) East Bay Paratransit will decide your eligibility within 21 days of receiving your complete application and conducting an interview. They will let you know if you are eligible or not. In some cases, they will contact your health care professional for more information. 

If they do not make a decision within 21 days, you will get temporary services from Paratransit until they make a decision.
attributes.service.type.name: Public Transit Assistance
attributes.materials.to.bring: - Bring completed application to your interview
attributes.target.population: People with disabilities or a disabling health condition that prevents them from using public transit.

nodes.label: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) at Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services - Central County

attributes.service.name: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP)
attributes.resource.name: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) at Contra Costa County Employment and Human Services - Central County
attributes.eligibility:
1. You must be a California resident
2. You must be a US citizen 
3. You must meet the income guidelines below:

Persons in Household	 Monthly Income
1	                                 $2,170.74
2	                                 $2,838.66
3	                                 $3,506.58
4	                                 $4,174.50
5	                                 $4,842.42
6	                                 $5,510.34
7	                                 $5,635.58
8	                                 $5,760.81
9	                                 $5,886.05
10	                                 $6,011.28
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Locate your local service agency by clicking on your county at this website: http://www.csd.ca.gov/Services/FindServicesinYourArea.aspx
- The service agency will be called either Utility Assistance & Weatherization Provider OR Energy Agency 
2. Visit the website for your local service provider to see how they would like you to apply for LIHEAP services. 
- Some providers will allow you to apply online while others will allow you to mail or drop off paper applications.
attributes.service.type.name: Energy Assistance/Subsidies (LIHEAP)
attributes.materials.to.bring:
Your local service provider will let you know what they want to you bring, but it is generally the following:
1. Verification of your legal resident/citizen status in the USA (birth certificate, naturalization certificate, green card)
2. Your current utility bill with your past due amounts AND any shutoff notices (15-day or 48-hour)
3. Proof of income for ALL members of your household who are 18 or older
4. Birth certificates for all children under 5 years of age
5. Valid ID for any members of the household who are 60 or older
attributes.target.population: Low-income California household in need of utility assistance

nodes.label: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Brentwood

attributes.service.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals
attributes.resource.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Brentwood
attributes.eligibility:
1. Income: If your annual income is below 138% of the Federal Poverty Level, you may qualify for income-based Medi-Cal. To check if you qualify based on income, see the first two columns of household incomes and the row that matches your household size here: https://www.coveredca.com/PDFs/FPL-chart.pdf
- If you have SSI, you automatically qualify for SSI-Linked Medi-Cal.

2. Immigration status: Any income-eligible lawfully present OR not lawfully present California resident can apply for Medi-Cal BUT Medi-Cal coverage may be limited for California residents who are not lawfully present 
- Not lawfully present residents are not eligible for any Covered California plans
- DACA recipients are not considered lawfully present
- If you have lawfully present family but you are not lawfully present, you may still apply for Medi-Cal for them. Please see this website for more information: https://www.coveredca.com/individuals-and-families/getting-covered/immigrants/

3. You may also qualify for MediCal if you are: 65 or older, blind, disabled, under 21, pregnant, in a skilled nursing or intermediate care home, on refugee status for a limited time, or have been screened for breast and/or cervical cancer. 

*Please remember there are many eligibility criteria, so it best to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To apply for MediCal: 
1. Online: Complete the Covered California online application here (Covered California and Medi-Cal use the same online application): http://www.coveredca.com/apply/
- You will need to create an online account to apply online, so please have a personal email address to use. 

2. By phone: Call Covered California Service Center at (800) 300-1506 to apply over the phone Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. OR to schedule someone to call you so you can enroll, visit: https://app.bigwavesystems.com/lp/a8c3085e-e597-4ac8-ba23-42f245fdfa11

3. In-person: Go to your local county human services office to fill out and submit a Covered California application in person. To find your nearest office, see here: http://www.dhcs.ca.gov/services/medi-cal/Pages/CountyOffices.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: Child Health Insurance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
To fill out an application you need the following information: 
-  Social Security numbers for applicants who are U.S. citizens, or document information for lawfully present immigrants who need insurance. (You only need to give this information for people in your household who are applying for coverage)

- Employer and income information for everyone in your family, even if they are not applying (Paystubs)

- Your federal tax information. For example, the person who files taxes as head of household and the dependents claimed on your taxes. (If you do not file taxes, you may still qualify for Medi-Cal coverage)

- Health insurance information for you or anyone in your household who receives it through a job

- Immigration documents for non-citizens, such as an ?A? number, USCIS number or arrival/departure document number.
attributes.target.population: Low-income adults, families with children, pregnant women, seniors, persons with disabilities, children in foster care, and former foster youth up to age 26.

attributes.service.name: SSI/SSDI/SDI
attributes.resource.name: SSI/SSDI/SDI at San Francisco Social Security Disability
attributes.eligibility: See application for eligibility
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1.) Can apply online with this link http://www.edd.ca.gov/disability/SDI_Online.htm

 if you would like to apply in paper you can request an form by 
         a.) visiting the online forms and publication's webpage and
             ordering one
         b.) Ask your doctor or employer 
         c.) Visit an SDI office 
         d.) Call 1-800-480-3287

2.)Gather required information (listed bellow)

3.)Complete Part A: Claimant's statement 
      - Submit your claim no  earlier than nine days after your first day 
       of disability and no later than 49 days after your disability begins.

4.) Have your doctor complete Part B

5.) Mail the finished Claim for Disability Insurance Benefits to: 

State of California 
Employment Development Department 
P.O Box 989777
West Sacramento, CA 95798-9777
attributes.service.type.name: SSI/SSDI
attributes.materials.to.bring:
Must provide the following information: 

-Social Security number
.
-California Driver License number.

-Most current employer?s business name, phone number, and mailing address (as stated on your W-2 or paystub).

-Last date you worked your regular duties and hours or date you began working at less than full duty or modified duty.


Provide this information ONLY if it applies to you

-Any wages you received or expect to receive from your employer (sick leave, paid-time-off (PTO), vacation pay, annual leave, and wages earned after you stopped working).

-Any workers? compensation claim information, if applicable.
If you receive in-patient treatment at an alcoholic recovery home or drug-free facility, provide the name, address, and phone number of the home or facility.

nodes.label: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Hercules

attributes.service.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals
attributes.resource.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office Hercules
attributes.eligibility:
1. Income: If your annual income is below 138% of the Federal Poverty Level, you may qualify for income-based Medi-Cal. To check if you qualify based on income, see the first two columns of household incomes and the row that matches your household size here: https://www.coveredca.com/PDFs/FPL-chart.pdf
- If you have SSI, you automatically qualify for SSI-Linked Medi-Cal.

2. Immigration status: Any income-eligible lawfully present OR not lawfully present California resident can apply for Medi-Cal BUT Medi-Cal coverage may be limited for California residents who are not lawfully present 
- Not lawfully present residents are not eligible for any Covered California plans
- DACA recipients are not considered lawfully present
- If you have lawfully present family but you are not lawfully present, you may still apply for Medi-Cal for them. Please see this website for more information: https://www.coveredca.com/individuals-and-families/getting-covered/immigrants/

3. You may also qualify for MediCal if you are: 65 or older, blind, disabled, under 21, pregnant, in a skilled nursing or intermediate care home, on refugee status for a limited time, or have been screened for breast and/or cervical cancer. 

*Please remember there are many eligibility criteria, so it best to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To apply for MediCal: 
1. Online: Complete the Covered California online application here (Covered California and Medi-Cal use the same online application): http://www.coveredca.com/apply/
- You will need to create an online account to apply online, so please have a personal email address to use. 

2. By phone: Call Covered California Service Center at (800) 300-1506 to apply over the phone Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. OR to schedule someone to call you so you can enroll, visit: https://app.bigwavesystems.com/lp/a8c3085e-e597-4ac8-ba23-42f245fdfa11

3. In-person: Go to your local county human services office to fill out and submit a Covered California application in person. To find your nearest office, see here: http://www.dhcs.ca.gov/services/medi-cal/Pages/CountyOffices.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: Adult Health Insurance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
To fill out an application you need the following information: 
-  Social Security numbers for applicants who are U.S. citizens, or document information for lawfully present immigrants who need insurance. (You only need to give this information for people in your household who are applying for coverage)

- Employer and income information for everyone in your family, even if they are not applying (Paystubs)

- Your federal tax information. For example, the person who files taxes as head of household and the dependents claimed on your taxes. (If you do not file taxes, you may still qualify for Medi-Cal coverage)

- Health insurance information for you or anyone in your household who receives it through a job

- Immigration documents for non-citizens, such as an ?A? number, USCIS number or arrival/departure document number.
attributes.target.population: Low-income California residents in need of health coverage.

nodes.label: Utility Discount (California Alternate Rates for Energy (CARE) Program) at Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG & E)

attributes.service.name: Utility Discount (California Alternate Rates for Energy (CARE) Program)
attributes.resource.name: Utility Discount (California Alternate Rates for Energy (CARE) Program) at Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG & E)
attributes.eligibility:
Program Guidelines:

1. The PG&E bill should be in your name 
- For sub-metered tenants, the energy bill from your landlord must be in your name 

2. You must live at the address where the discount is received

3. You can not be a dependent on another person's income tax return 

4. You can not share an  energy meter with another home.

5. You must tell PG&E if your household does not qualify for the CARE discount 

6. You may have to provide proof of income after you have enrolled in the program 

7. You must re-apply every two years 

Please visit website for more information.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. You can apply online, over the phone, by mail, or visit one of the CARE Community Partner locations to get free help on filling out the application. 

To apply online go to: https://www.pge.com/en_US/residential/save-energy-money/help-paying-your-bill/longer-term-assistance/care/care.page?WT.mc_id=Vanity_care

Go to link to find the list of  Partner Locations to get help on CARE application:
http://www.pge.com/includes/docs/pdfs/myhome/customerservice/financialassistance/care/education/COC_Enhanced_Info_List.pdf

If you fill out the application on paper, mail the application to:

Pacific Gas and Electric Company
CARE Program
Attn: COC Processing
PO Box 7979
San Francisco, CA 94120-7979

attributes.materials.to.bring:

nodes.label: Motel Vouchers for Homeless Families at Contra Costa Crisis Center

attributes.service.name: Motel Vouchers for Homeless Families
attributes.resource.name: Motel Vouchers for Homeless Families at Contra Costa Crisis Center
attributes.eligibility:
Criteria:
- This program is for homeless families (adults with children under 18) and seniors
-You must demonstrate that you have a plan for transitioning to a longer-term housing by the end of the 2-day motel stay. 
-You are ineligible if you have acute drug, alcohol, mental health or medical needs that would prevent you from managing in standard lodging without professional support.
-You are also ineligible if you have been housed previously by the Contra Costa Crisis Center agency under similar circumstances.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1) Call 800-833-2900 or 211 for immediate assistance. Staff are available 24 hours, 7 days a week. 

2) They will ask you questions about your situation and plan for housing to determine if you are eligible for the motel voucher program.
attributes.service.type.name: Emergency Shelter
attributes.materials.to.bring:
-Proof that you have a plan for transitioning into more stable housing. (This is usually proof from the referring shelter that there will be space for you to move in or the lease of a new apartment)

- A valid ID (this is not required by the Contra Costa Crisis Center but they strongly suggest having one as most motels require an ID)
attributes.target.population: Temporarily homeless families in Contra Costa County

Each Additional 
Member                                +720
- You MUST be a U.S. citizen OR a ?Qualified Immigrant,? which includes Permanent Legal Residents (holders of green cards), refugees, asylees (an individual who has been granted asylum), people granted withholding of deportation or removal, Cuban/Haitian entrants, individuals paroled into the U.S. for a least one year by immigration authorities, conditional entrants (temporary green card), and certain victims of domestic violence. Victims of human trafficking (T visa) and applicants for U visa/interim relief are also eligible for CalFresh.
- Supplemental Security Income/State Supplementary Payment (SSI/ SSP) Program recipients do NOT qualify for CalFresh, but other people in the person's household may still qualify for CalFresh
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. There are 2 ways to start your application: 
- Online: Select your county and apply at http://www.benefitscal.org/
- In-Person: Print and fill out an application in the language of your choice under the Application Forms section of this website: http://www.cdss.ca.gov/food-nutrition/calfresh and submit it your local county social services agency location here: http://www.cdss.ca.gov/County-Offices
2. Once your county social services agency receives your application, they will contact you to set up an interview to go over your application. Be sure to gather/bring all necessary materials for your interview.
3. It may take up to 30 days to process your application. The County will send you a letter to let you now if you are approved** or denied. 

**NOTE: If you qualify, you may be able to get benefits within 3 calendar days, if:
-Your household?s monthly gross income (income before deductions) is less than $150 and cash on hand/checking/savings accounts is $100 or less
- Your housing costs (rent/mortgage and utilities) are more than your monthly gross income and cash on hand/checking/savings accounts
-You are a migrant or seasonal farm worker household with less than $100 in checking/savings and your income has
stopped, or if your income has started but you do not expect to get more than $25 in the next 10 days.
attributes.service.type.name: Food Stamps/SNAP
attributes.materials.to.bring:
You MUST use the following materials to fill out your application AND bring them to your interview: 
- Identification (Driver?s License, State ID card, passport). 
- Proof of Residence (a rental agreement, current bill with your address listed). 
- Social Security Numbers for everyone in the household who has one (see note below about certain noncitizens). 
- Proof of money in the bank for all the people in your household (recent bank statements). 
- Proof of earned income of everyone in your household for the past 30 days (recent pay stubs, a work statement from an employer). 
  - NOTE: If self-employed, income and expense or tax records. 
- Proof of unearned income (Unemployment benefits, SSI, Social Security, Veteran?s benefits, child support, worker?s compensation, school grants or loans, rental income, etc.). 
- Poor of lawful immigration status ONLY for noncitizens applying for benefits (an Alien Registration Card, visa). 
  - NOTE: Certain noncitizens applying for immigration status based on domestic violence, crime prosecution or trafficking may not need this proof. They also may not need a Social Security Number.

To receive more benefits, you may use these materials to fill out optional parts of the application AND bring them to your interview: 
- Housing costs (rent receipts, mortgage bills, property tax bill, insurance documents). 
- Phone and utility costs. 
- Medical expenses for anyone in your household who is elderly (60 and older) or disabled. 
- Child and adult care costs due to someone working, looking for work, attending training or school, or participating in a required work activity. 
- Child support paid by a person in your household
attributes.target.population: Low-Income California residents in need of assistance paying for food

nodes.label: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office HQ

attributes.service.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals
attributes.resource.name: MediCal - Insurance for Low-Income Families and Individuals at Employment and General Human Services Office HQ
attributes.eligibility:
1. Income: If your annual income is below 138% of the Federal Poverty Level, you may qualify for income-based Medi-Cal. To check if you qualify based on income, see the first two columns of household incomes and the row that matches your household size here: https://www.coveredca.com/PDFs/FPL-chart.pdf
- If you have SSI, you automatically qualify for SSI-Linked Medi-Cal.

2. Immigration status: Any income-eligible lawfully present OR not lawfully present California resident can apply for Medi-Cal BUT Medi-Cal coverage may be limited for California residents who are not lawfully present 
- Not lawfully present residents are not eligible for any Covered California plans
- DACA recipients are not considered lawfully present
- If you have lawfully present family but you are not lawfully present, you may still apply for Medi-Cal for them. Please see this website for more information: https://www.coveredca.com/individuals-and-families/getting-covered/immigrants/

3. You may also qualify for MediCal if you are: 65 or older, blind, disabled, under 21, pregnant, in a skilled nursing or intermediate care home, on refugee status for a limited time, or have been screened for breast and/or cervical cancer. 

*Please remember there are many eligibility criteria, so it best to apply.
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
To apply for MediCal: 
1. Online: Complete the Covered California online application here (Covered California and Medi-Cal use the same online application): http://www.coveredca.com/apply/
- You will need to create an online account to apply online, so please have a personal email address to use. 

2. By phone: Call Covered California Service Center at (800) 300-1506 to apply over the phone Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. OR to schedule someone to call you so you can enroll, visit: https://app.bigwavesystems.com/lp/a8c3085e-e597-4ac8-ba23-42f245fdfa11

3. In-person: Go to your local county human services office to fill out and submit a Covered California application in person. To find your nearest office, see here: http://www.dhcs.ca.gov/services/medi-cal/Pages/CountyOffices.aspx
attributes.service.type.name: Child Health Insurance
attributes.materials.to.bring:
To fill out an application you need the following information: 
-  Social Security numbers for applicants who are U.S. citizens, or document information for lawfully present immigrants who need insurance. (You only need to give this information for people in your household who are applying for coverage)

- Employer and income information for everyone in your family, even if they are not applying (Paystubs)

- Your federal tax information. For example, the person who files taxes as head of household and the dependents claimed on your taxes. (If you do not file taxes, you may still qualify for Medi-Cal coverage)

- Health insurance information for you or anyone in your household who receives it through a job

- Immigration documents for non-citizens, such as an ?A? number, USCIS number or arrival/departure document number.

nodes.label: CalFresh Benefits Info and Registration (medical, food and cash assistance) at MyBenefits-CalWin

attributes.service.name: CalFresh Benefits Info and Registration (medical, food and cash assistance)
attributes.resource.name: CalFresh Benefits Info and Registration (medical, food and cash assistance) at MyBenefits-CalWin
attributes.eligibility:
- You and your household must live in California
- At least one person in your household must have a Social Security Number 
- Your household income must be less than the following: 
Income Guidelines
October 1, 2018 ? September 30, 2019
Household Size	Gross Monthly Income
1	                        $2,024
2	                        $2,744
3	                        $3,464
4	                        $4,184
5	                        $4,904
6	                        $5,624
7	                        $6,344
8	                        $7,064
*Add this amount for each additional member	+ $720
attributes.how.to.access.this.service:
1. Collect all income information for everyone in your household 
2. Use this income information to check your eligibility for CalFresh benefits here: https://www.mybenefitscalwin.org/web/consortium/home?p_p_id=welcome_WAR_calwinportlet&p_p_lifecycle=0&p_p_state=normal&p_p_mode=view&p_p_col_id=column-1&p_p_col_count=1&_welcome_WAR_calwinportlet_action=amIEligibleAnonymous
3. If you seem eligible, create an online MyBenefits CalWIN account to begin the online application here: https://www.mybenefitscalwin.org/web/consortium/home?p_p_id=welcome_WAR_calwinportlet&p_p_lifecycle=0&p_p_state=normal&p_p_mode=view&p_p_col_id=column-1&p_p_col_count=1&_welcome_WAR_calwinportlet_action=applyForBenefitsAnonymous
4. Gather the documents in the Materials to Bring to complete your online application as completely and accurately as possible.
5. Once you create an account, you will be able to apply for CalFresh benefits through the same website you used to create the account. 
6. After you submit the online application, you will need to submit copies of the Materials to Bring to your local county office.
attributes.service.type.name: Food Stamps/SNAP
attributes.materials.to.bring:
- Birth/Citizenship (Birth certificate, Passport, Baptismal certificate (with date and place of birth), Statement of witness to birth, Original birth certificates for Medi-Cal)
- Income (Most recent paycheck stub(s), Letter from employer, Copy of child support check or payment stub, Benefits award letter (Social Security/ Veterans/Unemployment/Disability, etc.), Self-employment tax forms (IRS Schedule C, etc.), Receipts for self-employment income for work expenses, School grants/loans/financial aid statements, Sponsor statement form)
- Immigration Status (non-citizens) (Immigration papers/forms/cards (copy of both sides), Certificate of naturalization, Other proof from immigration (USCIS), such as: work authorization, letter of decision or court order on your case, etc.)
- Property/Resources (Vehicle registration, Proof of loans or debts/liens on property, Statement of joint ownership, Most recent mortgage bill(s), Property deed, Most recent bank statements, Life insurance policy, stocks, bonds, IRAs, Most recent retirement account statement(s), Sponsor statement form, Settlements such as lawsuits and insurance claims, Burial plots/crypts)
- Proof of Other Expenses (Child/dependent care receipts, Statement from child/dependent care provider, Receipts for school expenses, Cancelled check/receipt of child/spousal support Payments)
- Identity (Drivers license or identification card, Photo ID (from DMV, school, etc.), Passport, USCIS documents)
- Relationship (Court papers (divorce, guardianship, etc.), Marriage certificate, Domestic partner certificate, Birth certificate)
- Housing and Utility Costs<U+00A0>(Rental agreement or rent receipts, Mortgage bill, Utility bill, Property tax statement, Home or renter's insurance bills, Hotel/motel receipt, Cancelled checks or copies, Statement explaining housing arrangement)
- Residence (Utility bill, Rental agreement, Bill or other document(s) with name and address, Driver's license or Identification card, Eviction notice/notice to pay rent or quit)
- Medical Expenses (Medical bills or receipts, Medical transportation bills or receipts, Health or dental insurance policies or premiums, Medicare card (for Medi-Cal only))
- Medical Verification (Proof of pregnancy from doctor or clinic, with expected due date, Doctor statement or disability funding by an agency (SSA/SDI/VA, etc.), Pharmacy bill)
- Immunization Records (for kids under 6 years old) (Statement that immunizations are against your beliefs, Statement from parent or caretaker relative explaining why you can't get, immunizations, Statement from doctor that immunizations are not available, Stamped shot record
attributes.target.population: Low-Income California households in need of food assistance
